alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; San Luis Obispo County Inland Central Coast; San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 3:14PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of San Luis Obispo County through 345 PM PDT... At 309 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of storms with isolated thunderstorms extending from 10 miles northeast of Paso Robles to 6 miles northwest of Santa Maria. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail, along with heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down trees and tree limbs, down powerlines, and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Luis Obispo...Paso Robles...Atascadero...Arroyo Grande... Shandon...Templeton...Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade... and Lake Lopez. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
